headline.main: FIFTEEN DAYS; CALIFORNIA SENTIMENT RELATIVE TO REPRESENTATIVE HERBERT. REVOLUTION IN COSTA RICA. Biography of one of President Pierce's Marshals. The Indian Troubles in Oregon-Bloody Battles. Constitution and Address of the Vigilance Commitee. Action of the Vigilance Committee IndorsedRefusal of Gen, Wool to Deliver Arms to the Governor-More Rogues Banished. LATER FROM CALIFORNIA, Continuance of the Revolution in San Francisco. Arrival of the George Law and Orizaba.

docs.lead_paragraph: The news from California is again of a very interesting character. We have advices by the Daniel Webster, which arrived at New-Orleans on the 12th, the George Law at this port yesterday morning, and the Orizaba, which arrived here last night. Pacific Mail Steamship Co.'s steamer, Sonora, sailed from San Francisco, June 20, 5 1/2 o'clock P. M.,

docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF ALDERMEN. Communication was received from George H. Patner, Esq., Attorney for the Corporation, to the effect that he has received, during the months of May and June, from sundry Companies and persons, for vilations of the City Ordinaces, the sum of $429, namely: $239 50 for May and $189 50 for the month June.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Return of the United States Connual--The Spanish Naval Force Retires from Vera Cruz.

docs.lead_paragraph: The veteran, WILLIAM R. ROBERTSON, who has been for some years discharging the duties- of the United States Consulate at Havana, left this on the Quaker City for Mobile on the 6th inst. Mr. THOMAS SAVAGE, Vice-Consul of the United Stated at Havana, has been recognized as such by General CONCHA, and remains in charge of the office until the arrival of the new appointment from Mississippi or the return of Mr. ROBERTSON.

headline.main: The Wild Women on a Legal Platform.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Probate Court, yesterday, an inquiry took place before Judge BURGOYNE, to ascertain whether "the wild woman of the Wachita Mountains," for some time past on exhibition in this city by Capt. Northcote, was a sane or insane person. She was brought into Court by Deputy Sheriff Shattuck, having walked from the jail in company with her usual attendant, a woman named Ann Walters.
